thread.title: Brad Paisley: 'God bless the Ashley Madison website hack'
thread.title_full: Brad Paisley: 'God bless the Ashley Madison website hack'

title: Brad Paisley: 'God bless the Ashley Madison website hack'
text:
CMA co-host Brad Paisley thanks Ashley Madison website hack for joke material THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   07, 2015 - 4:19 pmLast Updated: October 07, 2015 - 4:20 pm   
People: 
Video: 
At a New York event raising funds for the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum, Brad Paisley discusses finding funny current event topics for his Country Music Association Awards hosting gig alongside Carrie Underwood. (Oct. 7) Photos: 
Country musicians, Carrie Underwood, left, and Brad Paisley, participate in the Country Music Hall of Fame benefit concert at PlayStation Theater on Tuesday, Oct. 6, 2015, in New York. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP) 
NEW YORK CITY — Country star Brad Paisley said "God bless" to the hacking scandal that exposed users of an adultery website for joke material for the upcoming Country Music Association Awards. 
Paisley and Carrie Underwood return on Nov. 4 to host the awards, which has regularly featured the two cracking jokes about popular culture and current events in between performances. 
The two performed as a part of a Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum benefit concert featuring Paul Simon, Vince Gill and Emmylou Harris in New York City on Tuesday. 
Paisley said the genre's top awards show was the perfect place to make jokes about adultery. And Harris added, "We built our careers on cheating songs."
